answer_html: While little can be done rigorously, our prediction is that with \(x(0) = 1\) that \((x(t), y(t)) \rightarrow (1,2)\) as \(t \rightarrow \infty\).
answer_latex:
While little can be done
rigorously, our prediction is that with $x(0) = 1$ that
$(x(t), y(t)) \rightarrow (1,2)$ as $t \rightarrow \infty$.
hints_html: Consider the stability of each critical point and make a prediction based on this.
hints_latex:
Consider the stability of each critical point and make a prediction
based on this.
hints_raw: Consider the stability of each critical point and make a prediction based on this.
question: 6 (c)
sols_html: The only stable equilibrium solution is (1,2), which is a stable spiral. Saddle points and sources are unstable. While little can be done rigorously, our prediction is that with \(x(0) = y(0) = 1\) that \((x(t), y(t)) \rightarrow (1,2)\) as \(t \rightarrow \infty\).
sols_latex:
The only stable equilibrium solution is (1,2), which is a stable spiral.
Saddle points and sources are unstable. While little can be done
rigorously, our prediction is that with $x(0) = y(0) = 1$ that
$(x(t), y(t)) \rightarrow (1,2)$ as $t \rightarrow \infty$.
sols_raw: The only stable equilibrium solution is (1,2), which is a stable spiral. Saddle points and sources are unstable. While little can be done rigorously, our prediction is that with <math>x(0) = y(0) = 1</math> that <math>(x(t), y(t)) \rightarrow (1,2)</math> as <math>t \rightarrow \infty</math>.
statement_html:
Suppose the interaction between two species (\(x=x(t)\) is the â€œpreyâ€ while \(y=y(t)\) is the predator) can be modelled by the autonomous system:

\[\begin{aligned} \left\{ \begin{array}{c} \frac{dx}{dt} = x\left(3-x-y\right) \\ \frac{dy}{dt} = y\left(1+x-y\right) \end{array} \right.\end{aligned}\]

(c) If \(\displaystyle x(0)=y(0)=1\), determine \(\lim_{t\to\infty}x(t)\) and \(\lim_{t\to\infty}y(t)\).
